entry.title: Ruby Diamond (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that prominent Florida State University benefactor Ruby Diamond (pictured) had the middle name Pearl?

entry.title: imposition of Hindi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the slogan "One Nation, One Language" has been used to justify the imposition of Hindi?

entry.title: Axel Lagerbielke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Swedish naval officer Axel Lagerbielke was imprisoned in Lima for over a year, held in Callao and eventually escaped from Panama on an English packet boat to Jamaica?

entry.title: All-American Bitch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the title of Olivia Rodrigo's song "All-American Bitch" was derived from an essay by Joan Didion?

entry.title: Bob Barney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that attending the 1984 Summer Olympics inspired Bob Barney to establish an institution to research the Olympic Games?

entry.title: bought his company's affiliate station in Miami (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that CBS executive Laurence Tisch found out on a tennis court in the U.S. Virgin Islands that rival network NBC had bought his company's affiliate station in Miami?

entry.title: Out of All the Masts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mihai Eminescu's poem "Out of All the Masts", which Eminescu himself never intended to publish, has won posthumous praise as a "perfect combination of words"?

entry.title: Saunders Island (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saunders Island has a lava lake and is populated by penguins?
